posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.39.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here .

Release notes:

  • Now you can adjust the size of the chat list sidebar on touchscreen devices. So when you try to drag it won’t be such a drag, and the smudges on your screen are simply evidence of the power emanating from your fingertips.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.38.0-beta.1…v7.39.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

New Version: 7.39.0-beta.1

51 new commits since 7.38.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.39.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Add adhoc release channel for public ad-hoc testing [2]

  • After import, don't show chats in left pane unless they have messages [3]

  • Some improvements to adhoc builds [4]

  • Auto-retry transient update errors once [5]

  • Set verified attribute on import [6]

  • Fix color of quotes in chats with custom colors [7]

  • Fix UI for invalid timestamps [8]

  • Update link & sync UI [9]

  • Fix self-mention in groups [10]

  • Implement lower hand suggestion in group calls [11]

  • Fix sidebar drag handle for touch devices [12]

  • Localized release notes [13]

  • Sort story views by timestamp [14]

  • Fix flakey endorsements expiration test [15]

  • Update better-sqlite3 to 9.0.9 [16]

  • Upgrade electron-builder [17]

  • Clarify behavior for SMS-only conversations [18]

  • Upgrade message batch on import [19]

  • Only mark smsOnlyOrUnregistered for direct conversations [20]

  • Fix linux non-prod releases [21]

  • Improve copy-image context-menu algorithm [22]

  • Update mock-server to 10.2.0 [23]

  • Ensure chat list matches primary after backup import for certain directionless-message-only chats [24]

  • De-asyncify receipt handling logic [25]

  • Make aci optional in ContactsParser [26]

  • Ensure ACI in aci fields in backup [27]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.2 [28]

  • Export single contact, nickname [29]

  • Apply bounds to timestamps during backup import [30]

  • Improve invalid attachment locator handling [31]

  • Improve check in storage service comparator [32]

  • Release notes for 7.38 [33]

  • Update strings [34]

  • Update DNS fallback [35]

  • Bump electron from 33.2.1 to 33.3.1 [36]

  • Update sendStateByConversationId for lonely groups [37]

  • Fix backup import for unused admin call links [38]

  • Add React Devtools [39]

  • Fix import of link previews without date [40]

  • MessageRequests: Only add events to timeline if value really changed [41]

  • Update ClearingData screen UI [42]

  • Migrate to private class properties/methods [43]

  • Remove desktop.calling.adhoc flags [44]

  • QR code rotation [45]

  • Show info for permanently undownloadable visual attachments [46]

  • Improve performance of deleting all data [47]

  • Release notes for 7.39 [48]

  • Disable fsync during backup import [49]

  • Update strings [50]

  • 7.39.0-beta.1 [51]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.38.0-beta.1…v7.39.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

Link to previous beta:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.38 release Desktop Beta Feedback
If you don’t mind me asking, is there any chance you might be using Tor to start the calls?

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.38 release

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Screen currently becomes black for me on Windows after a while of not using Signal Desktop.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.39.0-beta.1/727e3d7391fe902463ca1d57e705c53ec8645fd05b5ecdbd1c93a52407d2b256.gz

Another service outage? Can’t remove someone from a group.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.38.0/4c47f945b58d0d90be8819f5368a3f272a3f1898a41cfa1f58d758c84cfeb1b4.gz

When I make a 1:1 call, Signal forces my bluetooth headphones to use the communication mode, making it sound low quality. This is not an issue with Discord. I have also disabled my bluetooth headphone mic in Windows entirely, so for some reason Signal is initalizing the low quality mode. Please

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.39.0-beta.1/90ae91e26ea9b3812f562da1e528597c1f6ae69d5a9f4a160a947361ae2b28b4.gz

My mic source is of course a cabled microphone that is unrelated to my headphones.

My current solution has been to nuke all my hands-free drivers so Signal can’t access them, but this is… suboptimal for obvious reasons lol.

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Unable to edit photos added as attachment in Signal:

The photos automatically show a not-available icon after being added.

When I have a profile active where only a few contacts should be able to contact me (this worked for a long time), at the moment all messages from all contacts appear. I even tried a profile where nobody was allowed to send me messages, still everything arrived. This was two days ago.

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
@erik55 I’m not sure what you mean by ‘profile.’ Maybe you made a Notification Profile on your phone? Desktop doesn’t support that feature quite yet. Either way, messages always arrive - that feature is about notification behavior.

Are you perhaps talking about different Signal accounts entirely? Or blocking contacts, and still getting message from them?

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked: Re: the bluetooth audio issue, what happens if you change the device selected in signal settings within a call to the ‘Default’ device rather than the ‘Communication’ device?"

Yes, notification profile, sorry. I’ve now found out, that apparently in earlier versions I had notifications deactivated on my signal desktop client, so incoming messages just didn’t disturb me during my work calls on desktop. And my phone stayed quiet due to the notification profile, so I have had the impression, that the desktop client also sticked to those notification profile rules.

Sorry for the noise.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It doesn’t matter which one I choose.

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

Screen currently becomes black for me on Windows after a while of not using Signal Desktop.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.39.0-beta.1/727e3d7391fe902463ca1d57e705c53ec8645fd05b5ecdbd1c93a52407d2b256.gz

@Whatnoww I took a look at your log, and I don’t see any clear errors, or even any kind of problematic shutdown (crash/force quit/etc.). Does the black screen ever recover once it happens?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Yeah, once I move the Signal window. I don’t think it’s happening anymore
